goal:
Ibec is Ireland's national business, industry and employers' federation. It is the largest and most influential organisation of its kind in Ireland. Representing 7,500 member companies across all sectors of the Irish economy, we engage with government and policy makers nationally and internationally to shape positive conditions for enterprise - driving growth, investment and employment.

Ibec also offers a range of professional services and supports to its members.

There are 50 dedicated business and industry sector associations within Ibec.

euInitiatives:
The activities and decisions of the European Institutions are of significant importance to Irish business. As such, Ibec continues to highlight Irish business priorities to the Council of the European Union, European Council, Parliament and Commission. Our firm position is that the EU Institutions must properly understand and respond to the needs of the business community to safeguard economic growth and employment creation.

Our specific areas of interest include - the European Semester; the European Commission’s work programme; single market; digital economy; trade; employment and social policy; energy and climate change; the investment plan and capital markets union; and better regulation.
